channel.title: 2 Simple Questions
channel.description:
First is, I went into the NPCHandler.java file and changed what the npcs say, then I SAVED it, but the thing is, after i go onto serv to test it, it doesn't way what I typed. Is there more further down the file?
Also, where do I go to change what user get when they do the ::Starter command?

item.title: 2 Simple Questions
item.dc:creator: @suomirunee suomirunee
item.description:
@suomirunee wrote:

[quote=“Green020395, post:1, topic:220706”]First is, I went into the NPCHandler.java file and changed what the npcs say, then I SAVED it, but the thing is, after i go onto serv to test it, it doesn’t way what I typed. Is there more further down the file?

Also, where do I go to change what user get when they do the ::Starter command?[/quote]
Use compile.bat or compiler.bat

item.title: 2 Simple Questions
item.dc:creator: @army_life army_life
item.description:
@army_life wrote:

rofl…

go to your client.java and search for (“starter”)

Ctrl f if you don’t know

then where it says

addItem(" , ")

You can delete or add items

so if your command looks like this
(Ripped this off my server)

[code]f (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“starter”)) {
if (starter == 0) {
addItem(995, 20000000);
addItem(861, 1);
addItem(392, 5000);
addItem(560, 1000);
addItem(555, 1000);
addItem(565, 1000);
addItem(892, 100);
sendMessage(“You recieve the offical C.C Starter packet!”);
starter = 1;
savemoreinfo();
savechar();
} else if (starter == 1) {
sendMessage(“Sorry.”);
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName
+ " Is a fag and trying to get 2 starters only 1 retard!");

        }
    }[/code]

you can add or delete stuff by simply

adding another

addItem("ITEMID, AMOUNT");

directly below the rest.

so basically

to add more items to your starter or change them put addItem("ITEMID, AMOUNT");

[hr]

To make NPC’S talk add this into your NPChandler.java

if (npcs[i].npcType == NPCID) { if (misc.random2(30) == 1) { npcs[i].updateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdate = "WORDS"; } }

Read full topic
